greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Mapping from half-antidiagonal reading of the triangle (as used in A028297) to the column-by-column reading of the triangular tables.
comment: Moves squares (A000290) to triangular numbers (A000217), i.e., A056536(A000290(i)) = A000217(i) for all i >= 1.

This sequence may be regarded as a triangular array read by rows: 1; 2; 4, 3; 7, 5; 11, 8, 6; 16, 12, 9; 22, 17, 13, 10; .... with row sums: A079824 = [1, 2, 7, 12, 25, 37, 62, 84, ...]. - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 16 2004
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: As a triangular array read by rows:
maple: triang_perm := proc(upto_d) local a,i,j; a := []; for i from 1 to upto_d do for j from 1 to floor((i+1)/2) do a := [op(a),binomial((i-j)+1,2)+j]; od; od; RETURN(a); end;
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 20 2000
